title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for answer

The average rate of change of f on the interval 0 ≤ x ≤ π is f(π)−f(0) π−0 = − e π −1 π . title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for f'(x)

1 point is earned for slope

f ′ ( x ) = e x cos x − e x sin x f ′ ( 3 π 2 ) = e 3 π / 2 cos ( 3 π 2 ) − e 3 π / 2 sin ( 3 π 2 ) = e 3 π / 2

The slope of the line tangent to the graph of f at x= 3π 2  is  e 3π/2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@461F@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
​1 point is earned for sets f'(x) = 0

1 point is earned for identifies x= π 4 , x= 5π 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4300@ as candidates

1 point is earned for answer with justification

f ′ ( x )=0⇒cosx−sinx=0⇒x= π 4 , x= 5π 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5749@

The absolute minimum value of f on 0 ≤ x ≤ 2π is − 1 2 e 5π/4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F6F@ .

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for g is continuous at x = π/2 and limits equal 0

1 point is earned for applies L’Hospital’s Rule

1 point is earned for answer

Note: max 1/3 [1-0-0] if no limit notation attached to a ratio of derivatives

lim x → π / 2 f ( x ) = 0

Because g is differentiable, g is continuous.

lim x→π/2 g(x)=g( π 2 )=0 By L’Hospital’s Rule, lim x→π/2 f(x) g(x) = lim x→π/2 f ′ (x) g ′ (x) = − e π/2 2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8C13@
